title: Biosecurity for Transporting Livestock and Poultry for Owners

tasks.task: Receive and manage transported livestock and poultry to prevent disease spread
subtasks: Designate a secure entry point for incoming trucks
Post admittance instructions and contact information
Inspect trucks and trailers prior to entry
Log vehicle entry details, including cleaning status
Instruct haulers on vehicle routes and loading areas
Verify transportation paperwork, including CVI, bill of lading, and brand inspection certificates
Ensure truckers wear clean footwear and coveralls during loading and animal contact
Confirm trailer cleanliness and proper bedding during loading
Inspect animals for signs of sickness or injury before loading
Double-check paperwork and secure gates after loading
Prepare unloading area, including quarantine facilities, for incoming animals
Examine transport paperwork upon arrival, including CVI and brand inspection
Verify and document animal numbers and classes upon unloading
Quarantine new animals and monitor for signs of illness
Provide fresh water and feed to new arrivals
Encourage truck clean-out after unloading for pathogen removal
Move transporter to a cleaning area post-unloading
Thoroughly hose down trucks and trailers to remove manure and pathogens
Sort out sick or injured animals before unloading
Examine arriving animals for health issues promptly
Implement quarantine procedures as per veterinary advice
Follow animal health protocols including examinations and vaccinations

tasks.task: Receive and manage transported livestock and poultry**
